auto_merge.commit_message: This reduces the time taken by clear() by over 20% with ASAN.
auto_merge.commit_title: test: don't block to wait for previous session's exit (#35885)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
This reduces the time taken by clear() by over 20% with ASAN.

Comparison of 3 runs from [`d92c098` (#35753)](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/d92c098378a9febc6a8e3b0c739b5ac1ff0f8d97) and 3 runs from [`d12f2f6` (#35885)](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/d12f2f6e557e910fb6b21d9651cbe460f1ebf6fc) (running time of functionaltest step only):

| **job** | **old (1)** | **old (2)** | **old (3)** | **new (1)** | **new (2)** | **new (3)** |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| **ubuntu asan clang functionaltest** | 18m 2s | 17m 19s | 17m 5s | 15m 26s | 15m 36s | 15m 21s |
| **ubuntu tsan clang functionaltest** | 17m 59s | 17m 48s | 18m 41s | 16m 24s | 18m 29s | 18m 52s |
| **ubuntu release gcc functionaltest** | 7m 22s | 7m 53s | 7m 44s | 7m 40s | 7m 28s | 7m 10s |
| **ubuntu arm clang functionaltest** | 8m 22s | 7m 42s | 7m 46s | 8m 4s | 8m 6s | 7m 51s |
| **macos intel clang functionaltest** | 13m 7s | 10m 44s | 12m 39s | 11m 38s | 13m 27s | 13m 12s |
| **macos arm clang functionaltest** | 7m 54s | 8m 4s | 7m 8s | 8m 0s | 7m 9s | 7m 42s |
| **ubuntu puc-lua gcc functionaltest** | 8m 29s | 8m 47s | 8m 37s | 8m 44s | 9m 9s | 8m 16s |
| **build using zig build (linux)** | 17m 15s | 17m 4s | 17m 12s | 16m 57s | 16m 48s | 16m 32s |
| **build using zig build (macos 15)** | 19m 6s | 17m 59s | 20m 17s | 20m 56s | 19m 7s | 18m 24s |
| **windows (functional)** | 13m 15s | 13m 34s | 13m 14s | 13m 13s | 12m 38s | 12m 49s |

There are a lot of fluctuations in runs of the the same commit, but at least the running time is consistently reduced in the **ubuntu asan clang functionaltest**, **build using zig build (linux)** and **windows (functional)** jobs.

comment_data.body: I added this as a public field following how `collect_text` was added. Should this be an argument of `ProcStream:spawn()` instead?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -136,6 +136,9 @@ end
 --- @field stderr_eof boolean
 --- Collects text into the `stdout` field.
 --- @field collect_text boolean
+--- Called after the child process exits.
+--- `time_to_exit` is only provided if close() was used.
+--- @field on_exit fun(time_to_exit: integer?)

comment_data.body:
> Should this be an argument of ProcStream:spawn() instead?

That would be a nicer interface, if it's not much trouble.

`collect_text` was done like this to avoid churn but it was kind of a hack. 

p.s. `test/client/` in general will hopefully be eliminated/upstreamed eventually, after `nvim` gains all the necessary builtin [features](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/34399) to act as a lua client.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -136,6 +136,9 @@ end
 --- @field stderr_eof boolean
 --- Collects text into the `stdout` field.
 --- @field collect_text boolean
+--- Called after the child process exits.
+--- `time_to_exit` is only provided if close() was used.
+--- @field on_exit fun(time_to_exit: integer?)

comment_data.body:
is this more intuitive name? `time_to_exit` sounds ambiguous (could be an "intention" or a "result"). "elapsed" is the common way to express this.

```suggestion
--- @param on_exit fun(elapsed_time: integer?)?  Called after the child process exits.
---                `elapsed_time` is only provided if close() was used.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -147,8 +148,10 @@ ProcStream.__index = ProcStream
 --- @param argv string[]
 --- @param env string[]?
 --- @param io_extra uv.uv_pipe_t?
+--- @param on_exit fun(time_to_exit: integer?)?  Called after the child process exits.
+---                `time_to_exit` is only provided if close() was used.

comment_data.body: I think in both cases it's a bit unclear that this is the time from when `close()` was called to when the process exits. Actually, since the callback can get the current timestamp itself, how about just passing the timestamp when `close()` was called instead? Still not sure how to name that one either, though. Probably just `closed` (`nil` is `close()` was never called)?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -147,8 +148,10 @@ ProcStream.__index = ProcStream
 --- @param argv string[]
 --- @param env string[]?
 --- @param io_extra uv.uv_pipe_t?
+--- @param on_exit fun(time_to_exit: integer?)?  Called after the child process exits.
+---                `time_to_exit` is only provided if close() was used.

comment_data.body:
> how about just passing the timestamp when `close()` was called instead? Still not sure how to name that one either, though. Probably just `closed`

👍
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -147,8 +148,10 @@ ProcStream.__index = ProcStream
 --- @param argv string[]
 --- @param env string[]?
 --- @param io_extra uv.uv_pipe_t?
+--- @param on_exit fun(time_to_exit: integer?)?  Called after the child process exits.
+---                `time_to_exit` is only provided if close() was used.

@@ -105,6 +106,7 @@ if prepend_argv then
 end
 
 local session --- @type test.Session?
+local session_test_id --- @type string?

comment_data.body: Added a `data` field to store arbitrary data in a session for this.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -105,6 +106,7 @@ if prepend_argv then
 end
 
 local session --- @type test.Session?
+local session_test_id --- @type string?

comment_data.body: the "session id" seems like it deserves its own field, e.g. `session.id` or `session.test_id`, assuming a session cannot have more than one "test id" associated  with it (though it may have "orphans" if multiple nvim processes are spawned).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -105,6 +106,7 @@ if prepend_argv then
 end
 
 local session --- @type test.Session?
+local session_test_id --- @type string?

comment_data.body: `test_id` is not the ID of the a session, and it is currently solely used to identify whether two sessions belong to the same test. Multiple sessions from the same test have the same test ID.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -105,6 +106,7 @@ if prepend_argv then
 end
 
 local session --- @type test.Session?
+local session_test_id --- @type string?

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  -- Multiple sessions may belong to the same test.
  new_session.data = { test_id = test_id }
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -501,16 +492,44 @@ end
 --- @return test.Session
 --- @overload fun(keep: boolean, opts: test.session.Opts): test.Session
 function M.new_session(keep, ...)
-  if not keep then
-    M.check_close()
+  local test_id = _G._nvim_test_id
+  if not keep and session ~= nil then
+    -- Don't block for the previous session's exit if it's from a different test.
+    session:close(nil, session.data and session.data.test_id ~= test_id)
+    session = nil
   end
 
   local argv, env, io_extra = M._new_argv(...)
 
-  local proc = ProcStream.spawn(argv, env, io_extra)
-  return Session.new(proc)
+  local proc = ProcStream.spawn(argv, env, io_extra, function(closed)
+    n_processes = n_processes - 1
+    local delta = 0
+    if closed then
+      uv.update_time() -- Update cached value of uv.now() (libuv: uv_now()).
+      delta = uv.now() - closed
+    end
+    if delta > 500 then
+      print(
+        ('Nvim session %s took %d milliseconds to exit\n'):format(test_id, delta)
+          .. 'This indicates a likely problem with the test even if it passed!\n'
+      )
+      io.stdout:flush()
+    end
+  end)
+  n_processes = n_processes + 1
+
+  local new_session = Session.new(proc)
+  new_session.data = { test_id = test_id }

title: test: don't block to wait for previous session's exit
